revised_title: The Thermal Emissivity of Thin Wires in Air: A Study of the Effect of Wire Diameter and Temperature on Emissivity
tldr: This study investigates the thermal emissivity of thin platinum wires in air and how it changes with wire diameter and temperature. The research shows that the emissivity increases with decreasing wire diameter and rising temperature, affecting the loss of heat from thin wires and having implications for electrical engineering applications such as glow lamps, hot-wire voltmeters, and fuses.
